form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Ms. Ernst (for herself and Mr. Coons) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Small Business and Entrepreneurship

form.official-title: To increase loan limits for loans made to small manufacturers, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Made in America Manufacturing Finance Act of 2025.
Section 3 of the Small Business Act (15 U.S.C. 632) is amended by adding at the end the following:

subsection.text: The term small manufacturer means a small business concern—

paragraph.text: the primary business of which is classified in sector 31, 32, or 33 of the North American Industrial Classification System; and
all of the production facilities of which are located in the United States.

section.header: Small Business Act loan limits for small manufacturers
section.text: Section 7(a) of the Small Business Act (15 U.S.C. 636(a)) is amended—

clause.text: by inserting except as provided in subparagraph (B), before if the total;
by striking would exceed $3,750,000 and inserting the following:
in clause (i), as so designated, by striking , except as provided in subparagraph (B); and inserting ; or; and
by adding at the end the following:
in the case of a borrower that is a small manufacturer, $7,500,000 (or if the gross loan amount would exceed $10,000,000);
by striking would exceed $4,500,000 and inserting the following:
in clause (i), as so designated, by striking section 7(a)(14) for export purposes; and and inserting paragraph (14) for export purposes; or; and
by adding at the end the following:

in the case of a borrower that is a small manufacturer, $9,000,000 (or if the gross loan amount would exceed $10,000,000), of which not more than $8,000,000 may be used for working capital, supplies, or financings under paragraph (14) for export purposes; and

paragraph.text: in paragraph (14)(B)(i), by striking than $5,000,000. and inserting the following:

subclause.text: except as provided in subclause (II), $5,000,000; or
in the case of a loan made to a small manufacturer, $10,000,000.

section.header: Small Business Investment Act of 1958 loan limits for small manufacturers
section.text: Section 502(2)(A)(iii) of the Small Business Investment Act (15 U.S.C. 696(2)(A)(iii)) is amended by striking $5,500,000 and inserting $10,000,000.
